reviewText: A good collection of wild-west type movies.  Enjoyable.
Classic Westerns! I love em all!

Universal has released another long awaited '4 Movie Marathon: Westerns Collection' featuring "The Far Country", "Whispering Smith", "The Plainsman" and finally on a pressed release, "Man in the Shadow." This is the first time "The Plainsman" and "Man in the Shadow" have been on a collection.

This collection does have English SDH and French subtitles along with English audio. "The Far Country" and "Whispering Smith" are in color while the last two are in B&W. "Man in the Shadow" is presented in 2.35:1 Widescreen and "The Far Country" is presented in 1.85:1 Widescreen while "Whispering Smith" and "The Plainsman" are in Full-screen format 1.33:1. This is a two-disc set with no bonus features included.

"The Far Country" (1954/97 Mins./Color/Widescreen)
James Stewart, Ruth Roman, Corinne Calvet, Walter Brennan, John McIntire, Jay c. Flippen, Henry (Harry) Morgan, Steve Brodie; Directed by Anthony Mann
"Whispering Smith" (1949/89 Mins./Color/Full-screen)
Alan Ladd, Robert Preston, Brenda Marshall, Donald Crisp, William Demarest, Fay Holden, Frank Faylen; Directed by Leslie Fenton
"The Plainsman" (1937/114 Mins./B&W/Full-screen)
Gary Cooper, Jean Arthur, James Ellison, Charles Bickford, Helen Burgess, Porter Hall; Directed by Cecil B. DeMille
"Man in the Shadow" (1957/81 Mins./B&W/Widescreen)
Jeff Chandler, Orson Welles, Colleen Miller, Ben Alexander, Barbara Lawrence, John Larch, James Gleason, Paul Fix; Directed by Jack Arnold.

Overall this is a good set of Westerns and if you don't have any of these I would recommend picking this up.
Love these movies and quality is great.
l enjoy to watch old classic western and it s working for CC ( closed Captain ) and bright and smooth !!

I bought this for the movie, "Man in the Shadow" that is hard to find these days.  The other movies I really didn't care about, I have seen then on TV several times.  For the money, it is a great buy.
Jimmy has made my life wondeerful!

I purchased this collection as it had the modern (1957/58) suspense film Man In The Shadow with Jeff Chandler and Orson Welles . It's not a men on horses western but rather the story of a small town sheriff (Chandler) investigating a Mexican worker's death at a massive ranch owned and operated by Welles' character .
Unfortunately , my favorite classic film streaming channel (ROKU's Classic Reel) has a badly butchered version of the film that runs only 68 minutes AND has several brutal and obvious cuts to this 81 minute gripper .
This is a great price for this film alone + you get several other fine classic films as well . All with English subtitles .

AVOID
This release crams two dual layered DVDs onto one disc which results in single layer inferior transfers for previously dual layered films. I purchased this release for Man in the Shadow at a big savings over the MOD version but did not realized they had squeezed four films onto two discs.
I own the Far Country original release and this one is less than half the size of the original.
Classic westerns and James Steward is always watchable. Not the cream of the crop, however, which accounts for the great price.
Got as a gift, was very pleased!
